revised_title: Microcracking and Stress Analysis in Bone: A Comparative Study
tldr: The authors conducted an experiment to study the microcracking around a circular hole in a bone plate and compared it with predicted stresses using a finite element analysis. They found that the Tsai-Wu anisotropic yield criterion best predicted the pattern of microcracking. The presence of microdamage in bone before failure suggests that damage-based criteria are more likely to be successful predictors of bone remodeling behavior than stress or strain-based criteria.
